data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 - Subsidy for Infrastructure - New
data.benefits: The scheme provides a 50% subsidy (up to Rs. 300 Lakhs) for infrastructure development on undeveloped land, a 50% subsidy (up to Rs. 500 Lakhs) for ETPs and DG Sets meeting government norms, a 25% subsidy (up to Rs. 250 Lakhs) for in-house training, testing, or R&D facilities, and a 25% subsidy (up to Rs. 500 Lakhs) for staff quarters or worker hostels.
data.eligibility: All new textile and garmenting units setting up after or on the date of announcement of policy.
data.conditions:
The cost of land shall not be considered as part of the project cost for the purpose of subsidy for Infrastructure. 

This subsidy will be provided only in case of set up of unit on undeveloped land parcels.
data.beneficiaries: All new textile and garmenting units setting up after or on the date of announcement of policy.
data.prerequisites:
The cost of land shall not be considered as part of the project cost for the purpose of subsidy for Infrastructure. 

This subsidy will be provided only in case of set up of unit on undeveloped land parcels.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.context: The Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 aims to boost the textile and garment industry in the state. It was introduced to attract investments, create jobs, and position Uttar Pradesh as a leading hub for textile and apparel manufacturing.
data.objective: a) Attract investment in the textile and apparel sector to the tune of Rs. 10,000 Crore b) Generate employment opportunity for 5 lakh persons c) Development of five (05) Textile and Apparel Parks through private sector d) 50% increase in earnings of Handloom and Power loom weavers e) Modernisation of power looms and their operation through solar energy f) Increase production of silk yarn in the state.
data.description:
a) Subsidy of 50% of the project cost for developing infrastructural amenities for self-use such as 
(i) Road, 
(ii) Drainage & Water Supply, 
(iii) Power Supply (power line, transformer etc.),subject to a maximum of Rs. 300 lakhs for each unit (at the rate of Rs. 100 lakhs for each of the components). This subsidy will be provided only in case of set up of unit on undeveloped land parcels. 
b) Subsidy of 50% of the project cost for establishment of Effluent Treatment Plants (ETPs) and DG Sets, subject to maximum of Rs. 500 lakhs for each unit. The ETP and DG Set should be as per norms set up by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), National Green Tribunal (NGT) or any statutory body of Government of India / Uttar Pradesh. This subsidy will be provided only in case of set up of unit on undeveloped land parcels. 
c) Subsidy of 25% of the project cost will be reimbursed, for developing an In-house training facility, Testing laboratory, Quality Certification Labs, R&D Centre, subject to maximum of Rs. 250 lakhs per unit. 
d) Subsidy of 25% of the project cost will be reimbursed, for construction of staff-quarter, worker’s hostel/dormitory, subject to maximum of Rs. 500 lakhs per unit. 
e) The cost of land shall not be considered as part of the project cost for the purpose of subsidy for Infrastructure.
data.how_to_apply: Scheme can be applied through Nivesh Mitra Portal of Uttar Pradesh Government
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.funding_mechanism: The beneficiary will get the benefit after the approval of application by the funding facilitator.
data.highlights: The Department of Handloom and Textiles, Government of Uttar Pradesh shall appoint a team of professionals as Project Management Agency (PMA) for policy implementation and supporting the department in publicizing the policy benefits among national / international investors, brands and other stakeholders and providing prompt support to the investors.
data.additional_info: Preference will be given to those resident/s, in purchase of land from UPSIDA, GIDA, NOIDA, GREATER NOIDA or other authorities, to start new employment.
